statements.name: PROC CATTRANSFORM
statements.description: The CATTRANSFORM procedure transforms categorical variables in SAS Viya. It supports binning and encoding methods that are commonly performed as part of the data preprocessing step in creating machine learning models.
statements.help:
PROC CATTRANSFORM <options>;                 
	CODE  FILE=filename;                 
	FREQ  variable;                 
	INPUT  variables ;                 
	METHOD  method(<options>);                 
	OUTPUT  OUT=libref.data-table<option>;                 
	SAVESTATE  RSTORE=libref.data-table;                 
	TARGET  variable / LEVEL=INTERVAL | NOMINAL <option>;                 
	WEIGHT  variable;

arguments.name: BINMISSING
arguments.description: places missing values into a separate bin whose bin ID value is 0

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the input data table for PROC CATTRANSFORM to use

arguments.name: DISTINCTCOUNTLIMIT=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum level limit

arguments.name: EVALUATIONSTATS{
arguments.description: requests evaluation statistics about the transformed variables

arguments.name: WOEADJUST=
arguments.description: specifies the weight-of-evidence adjustment value

arguments.name: WOEDEFINITION=
arguments.description: specifies the weight-of-evidence definition

arguments.name: MISSINGEVALNONEVENT
arguments.description: treats missing targets as nonevents

arguments.name: NBINS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of bins for all input variables

arguments.name: OUTLEVELBINMAP=
arguments.description: saves the bin mapping information to a data table

arguments.name: PREFIX=
arguments.description: specifies the prefix for the transformed variables

arguments.name: PREPROCESSRARE
arguments.description: groups levels whose frequency percentages are 5% or less with the next least frequent level until all percentages are greater than 5% before implementing the specified method

statements.name: CODE
statements.description: generates scoring code and saves it in a file that you can include in a SAS DATA step

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the file to write the SAS scoring code to

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: identifies a numeric variable in the input data table that contains the frequency of occurrence of each observation

statements.name: INPUT
statements.description: specifies one or more variables as input for binning or encoding

statements.name: METHOD
statements.description: specifies the binning or encoding method and any associated options

arguments.name: GROUPRARE
arguments.description: groups levels that have a rare frequency or percentage with the next least frequent level until a threshold has been satisfied for all levels

arguments.name: RARETHRESHOLD=
arguments.description: specifies the rare frequency threshold where levels whose frequencies are less than or equal to the threshold are grouped with the next least-frequent level

arguments.name: RARETHRESHOLDPERCENT=
arguments.description: specifies the rare threshold percentage where levels whose percentages are less than or equal to the threshold are grouped with the next least-frequent level

arguments.name: ONEHOT
arguments.description: uses one-hot encoding of the input variables

arguments.name: TREE
arguments.description: uses the supervised tree-based binning method

arguments.name: CRITERIA=
arguments.description: specifies the tree criteria

arguments.name: MAXNBINS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of bins

arguments.name: MINNBINS=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum number of bins

arguments.name: MINNOBSINBIN=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum number of observations to include in a bin

arguments.name: MINPERNOBSINBIN=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum percentage of observations to include in a bin

arguments.name: WOE
arguments.description: uses the supervised weight-of-evidence (WOE) binning method

arguments.name: MAXNBINS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of bins

arguments.name: MINNBINS=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum number of bins

arguments.name: MINNOBSINBIN=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum number of observations to include in a bin

arguments.name: MINPERNOBSINBIN=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum percentage of observations to include in a bin

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: creates an output data table that contains the transformed variables

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the output data table for PROC CATTRANSFORM to use

arguments.name: COPYVAR=
arguments.description: copies one or more variables from the input data table to the output data table

statements.name: SAVESTATE
statements.description: creates an analytic store for the model and saves it as a binary object in a data table

arguments.name: RSTORE=
arguments.description: specifies a data table in which to save the analytic store for the model

statements.name: TARGET
statements.description: names the target variable to use in the supervised tree-based and weight-of-evidence binning methods

arguments.name: EVENT=
arguments.description: specifies the event of a nominal target for calculating binary target statistics, which are Gini, weight of evidence, and information value

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: variable is used to weight each observation to perform a weighted analysis of the data
